intro: Dipsacus pinnatifidus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hogweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its tall, hollow stems and large, palmately lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. Dipsacus pinnatifidus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including meadows and woodland edges.
